New Records: Anrich Nortje took 4-7, the best bowling figures in the match
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka was bowled out for 77, their lowest T20 total
South Africa won by six wickets with 22 balls to spare
Heinrich Klaasen slammed Hasaranga down the ground for six and eased the pressure
David Miller survived a review and helped South Africa get to the target
Anrich Nortje was the star for South Africa in a complete bowling effort
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka captain Wanindu Hasaranga said they were hoping for 160-170 runs but knew it was a 120-130 wicket
South Africa captain Aiden Markram said the pitch was tough but they'll have to find ways to score on it
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka captain Wanindu Hasaranga said they still have three games to go in the group and need their batting to come together
South Africa captain Aiden Markram said he was happy with the win and credited the team's fielding effort
Miscellaneous Highlights: The conditions were very bowler-friendly and exceptional seam bowling was seen from both sides
The pitch was a bit of a heap in the end and was not as straightforward for South Africa as expected
The pressure is now on Sri Lanka to make sure there are no more stumbles so they can get through to the Super 8s
Others: The match was part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup Group D opener in New York
The next two matches for South Africa will be played on the same pitch and they'll have to adapt to the conditions
